column4: my /var/www folder is own by www-data  and my user A is member of www-data group but A cannot see the contents of www-data the permission of /var/www  is set to 771 what is the problem
if i set the permission to 777 only then it works
try 775, and make sure the group ownership is proper
i used id A  and i can see A is member of www-data
the owner of /var/www is www-data and group is alos www-data
doesnot that  mean A shuld have all permission to /var/www read write ex
if A has a different primary group, then not exactly...
do you have a firewall set up? look into ufw man pages
check to see if it's listening on your other interfaces with netstat -an | grep 3000
well... sounds like it's open, next step is verifying your access to it
how do i verify it can you plz tell me
try telnet from another host to port 3000... if you get "connection refused" then something is blocking you
i can connect to port 8080 but not 3000 how do i provide access on that port
that's most likely the only things stopping you, unless your application uses tcp wrappers
